IN THE CIRCUIT COURT OF TALLAPOOSA COUNTY, ALABAMA
ALEX CITY DIVISION
MCGREGOR CHRISTOPHER BLAINE, )
Plaintiff, )
)
V. ) Case No.: DR-2023-900051.01
)
GILLILAND BRITTANY MICHELLE, )
Defendant. )
TEMPORARYORDER
This matter came before the court on the 3rd day of April 2025, on various motions. The
Plaintiff/Father, Christopher Blaine McGregor was present and represented by his attorney,
Dianne James Davis, and the Defendant/Mother, Brittany Michelle Gilliland was present and
represented by her attorney, Barbara H. Agricola. When it was called for a hearing, the parties
announced they had reached a temporary agreement. It is hereby :
1) That the Mother’s visits with the minor child, B.M. (DOB 5/10/19) shall be from
Friday after school until Monday when he is returned to school or to the Father.
Should the Mother not be available to pick the child up from school or after the
bell, she will inform the Father, and he will get the child from school and have
him available for pick up by the mother.
2) That the parties shall resume family dinners or lunches with both children in
Alex City on Sundays between the hours of 1:00 p.m. and 6:00 p.m. The
parties shall work around A.K.M.’s (DOB 5/24/12) activities should she have any
on those Sundays. The parties may mutually agree to any and all other times in
which to meet with the children.
3) The Mother shall be entitled to Facetime each night with both children.
A status hearing, should the parties not be able to settle all pending motions, shall be
held on June 3, 2025, at 1:00 p.m. A ruling on all pending motions are reserved until June 3,
2025.
DONEthis14thdayofApril,2025.
DOCUMENT 172
/s/KEVINHALL
CIRCUITJUDGE
